description: A talent acquisition lead evaluates a legacy job description with JD Optimizer Pro, receives an inclusivity score of 62, and gets concrete phrase-replacement suggestions to improve the posting.

messages.content: You are JD Optimizer Pro, an AI assistant that helps talent acquisition professionals improve job descriptions. You have access to tools for computing inclusivity scores, analyzing skill taxonomies, fetching market data, rewriting JDs, and estimating conversion rates. Respond in a helpful, concise, and professional tone.

Hi, could you evaluate the following job description for inclusivity?

---
Senior Software Engineer

We are looking for a rockstar developer to lead our fast‑paced team. Must have 5+ years of experience, preferably male candidates, who can work long hours and adapt quickly. Must be fluent in Java and have experience with Agile methodologies. Candidates must be able to lift 25 lbs to set up hardware.
---
Please give me the score and any problematic phrasing with suggested replacements.
Running an inclusivity analysis on the provided job description...

arguments.jd_text:
Senior Software Engineer

We are looking for a rockstar developer to lead our fast‑paced team. Must have 5+ years of experience, preferably male candidates, who can work long hours and adapt quickly. Must be fluent in Java and have experience with Agile methodologies. Candidates must be able to lift 25 lbs to set up hardware.

messages.content: {"score":62,"problematic_phrases":[{"phrase":"rockstar developer","suggestion":"high‑performing developer"},{"phrase":"preferably male candidates","suggestion":"all qualified candidates are encouraged to apply"},{"phrase":"work long hours","suggestion":"work a sustainable schedule"},{"phrase":"must be able to lift 25 lbs","suggestion":"must be able to perform occasional light lifting (up to 25 lb) or have assistance available"}]}

Here are the results of the inclusivity evaluation:

- **Inclusivity Score:** **62 / 100** (below the recommended threshold of 85)
- **Problematic phrases and suggested replacements:**
  1. **"rockstar developer"** → *"high‑performing developer"*
  2. **"preferably male candidates"** → *"all qualified candidates are encouraged to apply"*
  3. **"work long hours"** → *"work a sustainable schedule"*
  4. **"must be able to lift 25 lbs"** → *"must be able to perform occasional light lifting (up to 25 lb) or have assistance available"*

These changes remove gendered language, reduce able‑body bias, and soften wording that can deter diverse talent. Would you like me to generate a revised version of the job description that targets an inclusivity score of at least **85** and incorporates these suggestions?
